op.title: [[ Broken Sky Online Quest - Session 5 ]]
op.comment:
> [[ Broken Sky Online ]]
> [[ Previous Threads ]]
http://suptg.thisisnotatrueending.com/archive.html?tags=Broken%20Sky
> [[ Unique Identifier: Ascheritte ]]
> [[ Character sheet and inventory updated and re-checked. ]]
http://pastebin.com/pZv3XUPQ
> [[ Twitter ]]
https://twitter.com/BrokenSkyOnline

> [[ Ancient Cathedral // PVP Disabled ]]

"Alright..." Ayla's voice echoes throughout the ancient cathedral's halls. You hear running water from outside, and the sound of distant hoof-beats on stone, but not much else. There's a pronounced hollowness to your own steps, and through cracks and gaps in the brick floor, you think you can see something below. A basement, perhaps an underground river? Likely, more of the abyss you beheld from above.

You and Nel are leading the group, with the other three following close behind as you walk down the aisle, weapons at the ready. He created a pretty suitable map of the area, but it's not terribly complicated. There's six pillars, three on either side of the room past the disheveled pews; it seems they once held up the ceiling, but are now mostly broken, though they still stand much taller than you. It's dusty, and dark, save for a faint light from outside, and more flecks of glowing quartz in the ceiling above.

> [[ 1/2 ]]

37804613.name: BSO
37804613.comment:
>>37804590

Behind you, the exit. Ahead, at the far end behind a stone podium, a filled-in arch in the wall is divided, bearing an intricate sandstone mosaic with a keystone missing in the center; it looks like it could open up to something with some coercion. There's doors on either side of the room, as well; through one, you can see a staircase descending into darkness, where you imagine Nel encountered the Pegasus.

"We'll have a lot of room when we fight," Nel says.

"Which means, don't rush if we don't have to." Ayla adds. "Bosses have unpredictable attack patterns, as I'm sure you've observed, so we'll have to adapt quickly."

"I'm expecting a lot of charging and swooping." Nel folds his arms, observing the room. "Dodging side-to-side seems obvious, and I think Tatsu's quick enough that she might be able to get on top of it, if that doesn't sound too reckless. The thing looks damn intimidating, though..."

"You think those guys outside fought it before?" Vision asks.

"Not sure." You reply.

[[ 1 ]]
> Prepare your scimitar. It's your most reliable weapon, and you'll need to get a lot of hits in.
> Prepare the pickaxe. The boss is going to be moving a lot, so you'll want to maximize your damage per hit.
> Prepare the stone pike. It doesn't seem as strong damage-wise, but offers great defensive options.

[[ 2 ]]
> Go chat with the party outside.
> Bandage your wounds. You aren't bleeding, but you can at least recover some HP.
> Take another look around the room.
> Have Nel call in the Pegasus.

37805682.name: BSO
37805682.comment:
>>37804959

"Alright, spread out a little bit." He says, heading for the far door and turning to shout before vanishing into the darkness below. "And get ready!"

You hear an incoherent yell, followed by rapid hoofbeats from below, and take a quick look at the rest of the party. Tatsumaki is waiting at your side. You need more Celestial Gems. Vision has his longcaster trained on the opening, and Ayla's standing behind you, tossing an orb up and down in her hand; it's got a translucent window on its surface that looks like it's made of something like fractaline crystal, and you can see it's sparking on the inside.

"Hey," You ask; so that's what she was talking about. "Will that damage us in a no-PVP zone?"

"Uhm." She smiles. "Food for thought."

"Guess it's better safe than sorry." Vision shrugs.

"He's getting close." Ayla says, stashing the explosive in favor of her guns. You and Tatsumaki take a step forward, assuming fighting stances. "Get ready."

> [[ 1/2 ]]

37805706.name: BSO
37805706.comment:
>>37805682

Nel emerges, the boss at his heels, wings unfurled overhead. It's much bigger than you imagined, onyx body ornamented in gold and jewels. It's wearing gilded armor, and has great granite hooves, with a glaring runed stump where a head should go.

The Obsidian Pegasus skids to a stop mere feet away from Nel, who jumps backwards, lashing at it with his daggers as Vision and Ayla open fire. As you begin moving forward, it rears back, and makes a ghastly noise vaguely reminiscent of a horse's whinny. The runes on its head glow, and you hear ubiquitous chanting as an orb of red light forms in the air in front of it.

Nel activates that skill again, moving back towards you on a seemingly-impossible vector and leaving luminescent after-images in his path. He narrowly dodges what comes next; the Pegasus stomps the ground, and the orb explodes with a massive blast of screaming red light and smoke.

You instinctively shield yourself from debris. It might be nerves, but you find yourself grinning.

"When it rears up, dodge!" Ayla barks, opening fire and running to the left. "Tatsumaki, go around!"

"Yes!" Tatsumaki responds, running faster than you saw her before.

"Ascheritte!" She continues. Vision's moving in the opposite direction, firing whenever possible. The Pegasus thrashes about, shielding itself with its wings. "Yell when you've got him cornered!"

From across the atrium, it turns to you, and leaps forward, taking flight a couple feet off the ground. It's quicker than it looks.

> Get out of the way.
> Dive under and slash.
> Try to get on top.
> Other.

37806059.name: BSO
37806059.comment:
>>37805869

> [[ 81 ]]

You see an opportunity, and take it, diving low and sliding on your knees. You lean back, passing under the Pegasus's front legs, and slash at it from beneath. Rather than glance off, your blade bites into the monster's stone body, which has an unsettling fleshy quality to it. It's a solid hit, and you move even faster to avoid getting trampled by the hind legs, pressing low to the ground.

Its hooves are inches off your face, when you note the red glow rising off your body. Haste.

Tatsumaki is running towards you, coming from the way the Pegasus just left. Vision and Ayla are on either side of the room. You don't see where Nel went.

> Unfortunate. Keep moving; you'll have to double back.
> Can't waste this opportunity. Grab on.
> Call for the explosive.
> Other.

"Ee-mergency!" You hear Nel's voice from the upper level, and take a quick look to see him engaged with several Guardian Constructs. The door at the far end of the walkway is opened outward, as if they appeared inside. Not fair! "We've got adds!"

> Nel defeated Guardian Construct. [[ Party: Vision, Ascheritte, Tatsumaki, Ayla ]]

"Kid!" Vision shouts. "You need help?"

"No, I've gotta keep them busy!" But he's handling himself better than you're used to seeing him, ducking under and diving between spearheads. He leaps toward another, plunging blades deep and following it to the ground. "Keep fighting! I'll shout if it gets bad!"

> Nel defeated Guardian Construct. [[ Party: Vision, Ascheritte, Tatsumaki, Ayla ]]

Tatsumaki is throwing heavy punches. You can hear each hit of her gauntleted fists, and they're taking chips out of the thing's golden armor, though it seems unfazed. You're having trouble getting your balance, holding onto the end of a gilded chain that's hooked into its breastplate as you're looking for somewhere to swing. Then, you see the runes on its head. They're glowing faintly, and as you focus your attention on them, red light bleeds gradually across its body...

>>37806899

> [[ 94 ]]

You're faster. You get a hold, and hoist yourself up, raising your blade high and driving it downward into the Obsidian Pegasus's head. The red glow dissipates slowly, bleeding off into the surrounding environment as you torque the blade. It whinnies, thrashing in the air. Tatsumaki begins to lose her balance, but is righted by a hit from an obsidian wing; you think you hear a bone crack.

Then, you feel it. A hateful glare, fixated on you, from all directions at once, as you defile the ancient runes.

You think this thing is dying. Vision's caster bolts strike from below; Ayla is looking for a better position. Nel throws a stone pike from the walkway, barely missing.

You withdraw your blade, and hear that ghostly whinny again as it swirls in the air, another red orb--this one visibly unstable--appears in front. Can it still use that? You don't know if the hitbox extends onto its body, or if it'll be able to fly into the explosion from its own attack.

> Try to force it toward the walkway.
> Jump for one of the pillars.
> Drop and take the fall.
> Have Tatsumaki slam it.
> Other.

37807741.name: BSO
37807741.comment:
>>37807422

> [[ 1 ]]

"Tatsumaki!" You point to the walkway where Nel is, and grab onto the golden chain, using it like reins. She nods, sliding past you to take the Pegasus by the neck, still pounding away at it, and help steer it in the right direction.

Its body turns, and it drifts through the air, rolling a bit to face the two of you toward the oncoming blast.

A ghostly wail fills your ears. You're bathed in raw energy, view obscured by red-white light, as if you were in the center of a small star. It doesn't burn you in any way you're used to; rather, you feel it chill your soul, threads of ice crawling front to back across your brain and down your spine. There's wetness on your lips and chin.

> [[ Ascheritte: 8 / 24 HP ]]

You can see Tatsumaki's eyes are rolled back. Blood is pouring from her nose, and her arm looks like it's been knocked out of place.

You keep hold, but miss the walkway.

The Obsidian Pegasus crashes into the wall about a foot below the archway openings, sending the three of you tumbling the rest of the way to the ground. You take the fall, managing to recover before you crash down. You don't see what happens next. There's a plaintive squeak, a cloud of dust, and a shower of rubble.

You see the Obsidian Pegasus struggling to get off of its side, wings heavily damaged. Tatsumaki is stuck under it, and she's twitching, trying to pull herself free. Ayla is running towards you, yelling, explosive in hand. You haven't seen her like this. She's worried, ready to make a move, but she gives only the simplest order. "Asheritte! Go! Now!"

> Try to help pull her out.
> Use the pike. Keep it still while she gets free.
> Retreat.
> Other.

> Nel defeated Guardian Construct. [[ Party: Vision, Ascheritte, Tatsumaki, Ayla ]]

You can't see what's going on upstairs. You hear weapons clashing. Stone against stone, and stone against steel.

"I've got you!" You charge forward, wedging the pike into the ground beneath the Pegasus. It's almost too heavy to lift. A wing flails by, and you duck away. 

> Nel defeated Guardian Construct. [[ Party: Vision, Ascheritte, Tatsumaki, Ayla ]]

You hear your pike crack, and try to lift just enough to give her some room.

It bends at the balance point, about to give way.

Then, breaks, just as the small girl scrambles free from beneath the Pegasus. The damage is visible. She doesn't look like she should be moving as quickly as she is.

Ayla's ready to throw her bomb, but the Pegasus is recovering.

> Keep it down with the broken spear.
> Dodge.
> Other.

37808425.name: BSO
37808425.comment:
>>37807979

"Out of the way, now!" Ayla shouts. "I'm throwing it!"

"Just wait! Vision, shoot the legs!" You yell. Caster fire sails past you, and you raise your second pike overhead, slamming it downward into the creature's wing. You hold it there. Just wait. "Nel, down below!"

You force the Pegasus down. Just a little bit more.

"Hang on, guys! Ascheritte!" You hear Nel's voice from above, and see him on the archway. His face is bruised like he's been punched a few times, and you think there's a piece of some weapon stuck in his shoulder. "I'm fucking jumping, okay!"

You're not sure what you wanted from him, but he's falling before you can advise him otherwise, a stone pike pointed downward. It misses the mark, instead hitting the creature's body near the base of its other wing, and he stumbles backwards, falling to his knees and scrambling away from kicking hooves.

"Ayla! Now!"

"Already going!" She yells, and hurls the explosive. The metal sphere bounces off the boss's body, and gives off a purple spark in the air adjacent, just as it reaches its feet.

Then, there's a nicely Pegasus-sized explosion, a coil of violet light that whirls outwards before giving way to a brilliant, burning blast; there's a low, flatulent sound, and a shockwave that almost knocks you off your feet at this distance.

The smoke clears, and the creature's body is broken. Wings are cracked and torn, and one leg is bent backwards, hanging by just a bit of mottled stone. You draw your scimitar, preparing to move closer. Then, it collapses, the light in the defiled runes growing faint.

> Obsidian Pegasus was defeated. [[ Party: Ascheritte, Ayla, Nel, Tatsumaki, Vision ]]
> [[ Level 4: You have 1 unspent EXP. ]]

> Other

"Already going!" She yells, and hurls the explosive. The metal sphere bounces off the boss's body, and gives off a purple spark in the air adjacent, just as it reaches its feet.

Then, there's a nicely Pegasus-sized explosion, a coil of violet light that whirls outwards before giving way to a brilliant, burning blast; there's a low, flatulent sound, and a shockwave that almost knocks you off your feet at this distance.

The smoke clears, and the creature's body is broken. Wings are cracked and torn, and one leg is bent backwards, hanging by just a bit of mottled stone. You draw your scimitar, preparing to move closer. Then, it collapses, the light in the defiled runes growing faint.

> Obsidian Pegasus was defeated. [[ Party: Ascheritte, Ayla, Nel, Tatsumaki, Vision ]]
> [[ Level 4: You have 1 unspent EXP. ]]

> Other

37808862.name: BSO
37808862.comment:
>>37808425

You breathe a sigh of relief. "Damn, that was a close call. Almost ended up Nameless."

"You're telling me." Ayla says. "Why'd you even climb on that thing?"

"Worked, didn't it? Now, Tatsumaki's gonna need some bandages, if anyone has spare." You suggest.
> [[ There are herbs and poultices in your backpack. You're not poisoned, but you can still use them to recover a bit of HP. ]]

"I've got some extra. You look hurt as well." Ayla says. She hands you a bundle, and you don't deny the offer, using them to restore your HP.

> [[ Ascheritte: 14 / 24 HP ]]

You dab a wad at your nose to staunch the bleeding there as well, though it doesn't do much other than for your psyche. Ayla helps tend to Tatsumaki's wounds, and once she's back on her feet, the five of you begin the affair of looting.

"Alright," Nel says. "That was damn awesome."

"Mhm." Vision chuckles. Seems uncharacteristic, for a moment. "I gotta hand it to you guys. We do good work."

"Alright, shall we take a look?" Nel asks.

"Let's see, we've got..." Ayla crowds the corpse, and immediately blushes, looking a bit giddy all of a sudden. "Oh, Gods... I didn't think I'd find..."

"Gems." You try to keep your head straight, though the allure is strong, present even in the faint luminescence they give off. You plant a hand on Ayla's shoulder, trying to steady her. "What's the rest of this stuff?"

> [[ Inventory - obsidian pegasus ]]
jewels, worth 600 credits
Sanctum Keystone
Celestial Gem x2
pegasus gilded mail, damaged
pegasus bracelet
gold chain
gilded armor scraps
onyx shard, small x12
onyx shard, large

"R-right." Ayla says, shaking her head. "The shards are crafting materials for weapons and armor. NPCs and players can make stuff with it. That chain doesn't look useful, but I bet the bracelet is magic."

"And the gilded mail and scraps are boss loot." Nel nods. "You could fix the mail up and wear it as is, or have it reforged into something you like more."

"How are we divvying it up?"

37809157.name: BSO
37809157.comment:
>>37808979

"I believe I'm overdue for a Gem." Vision says.

"As is Tatsumaki," You add. The two of them seem like a weight has been lifted off of them. "Help yourselves."

"Mm..." Ayla seems puzzled.

"Something wrong?" Nel asks.

"No, no. It's interesting. The Guardians found the first Gems, and we've got four in our possession from just this run." Ayla says. "And we know of plenty more underground branches that are at least as large as this one, though they probably don't all have ancient ruins in 'em."

"So?"

"There'll be more Artifacts soon, assuming others are having any success." She says. "And who knows how many the Guardians have by now?"

"Some of them could be stacked." Nel nods.

"I'm sure Liza is." Ayla folds her arms. "That being said, I think I'd like this bracelet. All opposed?"

"You'll figure out what it does faster than I would, I bet." You nod, grabbing the various bits of broken armor and the large Onyx shard.

"None." Nel says. "If this chain isn't that useful, I guess I'll have it. Might be worth something."

"I'd first melt it down." Vision shrugs. "Pass me some of those shards, and I'll split the credits."

"Ashe, I'll buy those scraps from you for my share of the credits!" Nel says. "I gotta look fancy too."

"I think I might need them to repair the armor." You say. "I'll think about it if that's not the case."

"Alright." Nel responds. "So, that just leaves... this rock."

"Uhm." You heft the keystone and size it up--an intricate pattern that matches the one on the wall under the arch--before setting it back down. "I think it opens that wall."

37809928.name: BSO
37809928.comment:
>>37809157

"Anyone ever heard someone mention the name Kjorikos?" You ask.

"Yeah." Ayla responds. "Dorian got a consultation, once, asking about powerful beings in the ruins beneath Averron. It was one of the names he dropped, but he didn't get a whole lot of. He spends like, almost all of his credits on those things. I'm trying to convince him to save up for a prophecy."

"Ugh..." Nel groans. "You guys and your useful consultations."

"Why do you ask, Ascheritte?" Ayla folds her arms.

"That was the other part of my consultation. I just wanted to see if you knew. Whoever he is, he's through that door. I'm gonna hang onto this key, alright?" You say.

"If the boss respawns, anyone coming through will be able to get another." Vision nods. "But it'll save us the trouble if we decide to try and come back through another time."

"Hell," Ayla says, "I've no doubt that you could just wish up an extra key with Celestial Gems."

The five of you make your way to the other room. The door isn't locked, and is in fact parted slightly.

> [[ Ancient Cathedral - Velika's Tomb // PVP Disabled ]]

It's a strange, lavish looking place, halfway between a tomb and an opulent bedroom, were such a thing possible. The walls are, or were, decorated; there's spaces in the dust that likely once housed ornaments. There's a large tapestry on one wall, and a few silken veils arching across the ceiling trim. There's an enormous sepulcher that's half open--empty, save for a mummified and bandaged body that looks more like part of the scenery than something you'd be able to interact with.

There's a dusty, framed portrait inside, covered in cobwebs. It depicts a young woman, with long, braided hair. She's lovely, but something about the painting unsettles you.

At the foot of the sepulcher, a small chest, also open, and empty.

> [[ 1/2 ]]

You take the dusty memento.

There's a beat, a strange, intrusive thought. You feel hated.

> You spend EXP on Offensive Mastery, learning Weapon Mastery.

> [[ Offensive Mastery 2 offers a choice from: ]]
* Concussive Strike // Active // Spend PP to make an attack that deals increased damage and can knock targets back a significant distance. Required for: "Overpower", "Charge", "Whirlwind Attack".
* Critical Threat // Passive // Slightly increases critical strike range. Required for: "Fleshrend", "Unarmed Fighter".
* Two-handed Mastery // Passive // Increases the effectiveness of two-handed weapons, which become lighter and more balanced in your hands. Required for: "Titan's Strength".
* Dual Wield Mastery // Passive // Increases the chance to hit with a weapon wielded in the off-hand. Required for "Cross Strike", "Titan's Grip".
* Whirlwind Attack // Active // Spend PP to make a barreling attack that deals damage to all targets in your weapon's reach. [[ Unavailable: Requires "Concussive Strike" ]] 

"I'm gonna try to make an Artifact." You say.

"Uhm, one Gem?" Ayla shrugs. "I'm not gonna stop you, but you might end up with something comparatively underwhelming if you can land it. If the process is like Manifestation, it's a little weird, though."

"What do you mean?" You ask.

"You have to pray for satisfaction before the statue." She folds her arms. "Speak your desire aloud, and the Celestials will name their price."

"If that's the case, why don't you just ask them about everything?" Vision glares at her.

"They aren't as talkative as you might think." She responds. "It's weird. You'll know when you try it."

> Leave.
> Other.

>>37811066

"I'll lead the way." Nel lights a fluorescent torch, a rod with a green light at one end, soft, though bright, and makes his way down the stairs to where he pulled the Pegasus from. "It's like a maze. I'm not sure if there's much of anything down here. Stay close, alright?"

"Alright..."

You can see drains and holes in the walls where water pours in from outside. Weapons ready, you wade into ankle deep water by torch-light. The underground area seems to lead you in circles, to small openings and tunnels underneath the atrium. You don't find much of anything, and usher Nel, out of curiosity, in the direction of the parted wall.

There's occasionally a vibration as you round a corner. It feels like the walls are staring at you.

> [[ Ancient Cathedral - Inner Sanctum // PVP Disabled ]]

Then, you pass under a thick glass ceiling, where you can see far up above. A spiral staircase leads up through a tower with many floors and many doors, gold trim and opulent chandeliers. When the party's footsteps fall silent, you hear a distant sound high above, high-pitched, grinding, whining, like the point of a sword being dragged across a glass table. It's rhythmic, like a machine, like breathing, footsteps or heartbeats.

You don't find much of anything down here.
> Leave.
> Other.

37811469.name: BSO
37811469.comment:
>>37811302

Through the glass, you can see what you think is the other side of the parted atrium wall. This must be what the Sanctum Keystone opens; in hindsight, it seems a little bit obvious.

Nel is already groping the walls for Celestial Gems, a bit awkwardly.

"That's what's on the other side of the wall, then?" Vision says. "Fun. I'm not excited to see what's making that noise."

"It's gonna be troublesome, for certain." Ayla says. Tatsumaki glances up at her, and receives an idle pat on the head for her troubles. "I think we can come back, though. We've got the key, and people might want to visit town, or break for a bit."

"Right, then." Nel says. "Let's get out of here. Stay close, the journey up could be dangerous. Good to go, Ashe?"

"Yeah, I'm ready." You respond.

Then, your muscles seize, and you shake back and forth wildly and involuntarily. Nel and the rest of your party gradually grow more distant, though they're moving closer to try to reach you. It's becoming a lot warmer, a lot less damp. You feel your soreness fading, as well as a fleeting temptation to make sure your Celestial Gem is intact.

Then, there's a buzzing in your ears, the same as when you first launched Broken Sky Online.

> [[ Calibrating, please wait... ]]

It grows louder, and softer, fluctuating rapidly through different pitches and volumes, then stops abruptly.

> [[ Connection interrupted. ]]

[spoiler]Archiving. Might not be able to run until Friday, as I've a test to study for. Stay tuned.[/spoiler]
